Dear Mr. Edgar:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
September 26, 2018. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(f) If the employee has criminal convictions, the chief
administrator or his or her designee shall complete a written
evaluation of the convictions that addresses the nature of the
conviction, the length of time since the conviction, and the
relationship of the conviction to regulated activity.
One of three new employee records reviewed showed a 2016
misdemeanor conviction for the employee and the record did
not show documentation of a written evaluation of the conviction
by the chief administrator or his or her designee.
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(g) A written statement from the employee regarding any
convictions.
One of three new employee records reviewed showed a 2016
misdemeanor conviction for the employee and the record did
not show documentation of a statement from the employee.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
None.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
Not applicable.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12212 Employee record (4).
The agency is advised consistently indicating the specific name of the training,
number of hours and person completing the training on its training log may aid it in
showing clear documentation of the rule. This would be inclusive of documenting
what specific training was held at a staff meeting, not just indicating “staff meeting”
as the training.
R400.12509 Independent living record(3)(o).
Consultation was given pertaining to more refinement of the agency’s service plan,
so it more clearly shows the plan’s completion date, service time frame dates,
youth’s current adjustment, assessment of level of independent functioning and
progress in achieving the youth’s independence goal.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
This corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2017 Interim Inspection. At that
time the agency received three rule violations. Those violations were R400.12206
Staff qualifications (connected to the agency requiring annual tuberculosis
screening); R400.12212(2)(h) for Personnel records; and R400.12509(3)(o) for
Independent living record. The agency did not receive any repeat violations from
that Interim inspection, or the last three years. It is in compliance with its Interim
corrective action plan.
The agency is at full resident capacity and reports it has had steady placement this
year. The agency received a $200,000 Health and Services grant. These funds
have enabled it to hire another case manager and an assistant case manager; and
to develop a Homeless Prevention Program. The Homeless Prevention Program will
offer services to homeless young adults while those individuals pursue housing. It
will also enable them to advance residents who reside in their Transition Living
Program to home occupancy in one of two of their two-bedroom rental properties
that they are developing to provide assisted independent living services.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
